Techniques of Information Retrieval .A Vickery, B.C. Information retrieval is now an accepted part of the new discipline of information science and technology, and its principles are taught not only in librarianship and documentation, but also in courses of systems design. There are half a dozen useful texts available, each with a special emphasis arising from the varied backgrounds and interests of the authors. .X 39	1	1405 159	1	1405 161	1	1405 175	1	1405 197	1	1405 257	1	1405 258	1	1405 375	1	1405 429	1	1405 445	1	1405 454	1	1405 459	1	1405 472	1	1405 480	1	1405 485	1	1405 489	1	1405 493	1	1405 498	1	1405 501	1	1405 503	2	1405 506	1	1405 507	1	1405 532	1	1405 554	1	1405 579	1	1405 582	1	1405 583	1	1405 591	1	1405 593	1	1405 594	1	1405 595	1	1405 596	1	1405 597	1	1405 599	1	1405 600	1	1405 603	1	1405 604	1	1405 606	1	1405 625	1	1405 646	1	1405 653	1	1405 655	1	1405 688	1	1405 723	1	1405 724	1	1405 758	1	1405 796	1	1405 797	1	1405 798	1	1405 801	2	1405 802	1	1405 805	1	1405 806	1	1405 826	1	1405 836	1	1405 866	1	1405 867	1	1405 956	1	1405 989	1	1405 1263	1	1405 1298	1	1405 1299	1	1405 1327	2	1405 1357	1	1405 1391	1	1405 1405	11	1405 1405	11	1405
